Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style, possibly patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired reddish) with two added white bands; exterior: double saw-edged metope pattern in handle zone with group of verticals to the right, between bands; brown band on lower wall
Curator's comments: The number '18' is inscribed in pencil on the exterior surface.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 302, no. 1089)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1146) (phase 2)
